page.title: 13HOSPITALS IN CATERHAM PAGE 2
page.content: In St Lawrences staff give support, security, training in daily living skills, work opportunities, leisure activities, friendship and affection. One well-known resident was{JOEY {DEACON.}He could not speak or control his movemnets. He made noises which only his friend Ernie understood. Ernie told Tom what Joey had said. Tom wrote it down and gave it to Michael who typed it using one finger. This was published as a book called{"JOEY". Many people read Joey's book including Dutch people who sent some money to the hospital. A bungalow was built with the money. 1981 was the Year of the Disabled and{BLUE PETER}raised some money to build more bungalows. In these bungalows live the five children who are resident in the hospital. { }
